intro: Moquilea dodsonii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the saline and humid conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Moquilea dodsonii plays an important ecological role in its environment, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
